text: 50 Years of challenges, accomplishments, and the continuing quest for educational equity. The Latino Education and Advocacy Days (LEAD) summit brings together those sharing a common interest and commitment to education issues that impact Latinos to help them define the future.
CSUSB criminal justice and MBA online programs ranked among best in the nation

Cal State San Bernardino’s criminal justice master's and MBA online programs have been listed among the best in the nation, according to U.S. News & World Report’s 2020 rankings of online academic programs.
Professor awarded CSU Quality Learning and Teaching certification
Jonathan Anderson is the first CSUSB faculty member to receive the CSU Quality in Learning and Teaching certification for his online course.
Recent rankings continue to show CSUSB Jack H. Brown College is one of the best in the nation

Recent national rankings of the nation’s colleges and universities continue to place Cal State San Bernardino’s Jack H. Brown College of Business and Public Administration among the best business colleges in the country.
CSUSB Palm Desert Campus receives $50,000 grant to help students in need of emergency funding
The grant was presented to the Palm Desert Campus to create a needs-based, financial support system for current students enrolled at the university.
Once and for all: Yotes capture CSUSB's first National Championship!

Cal State San Bernardino claimed a national title for the first time in its history when the top-ranked women's volleyball team defeated Nebraska-Kearney Saturday night to win the 2019 NCAA Division II Championship. Coach Kim Cherniss guided the Yotes to a perfect 33-0 record, which also featured a fourth straight CCAA title and the 2019 West Regional Championship.

CSUSB Alumni Alana Muller is the embodiment of life and career ready. Alana has earned over 20 awards during her time at CSUSB and is continuing to trail-blaze in her academic endeavors. She credits CSUSB in being instrumental in her personal growth. She is currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Psychology at the University of Arizona.
Unique, Innovative, Valuable - Graduate Programs at CSUSB
Graduate students at Cal State San Bernardino are given the flexibility they need to complete their degrees, while they gain the skills necessary to advance their future.
Global leader in the human resources industry, Janice Bryant Howroyd, to speak at CSUSB

Businesswoman, entrepreneur, and founder of The ActOne Group, Janice Bryant Howroyd, will discuss her new book "Acting Up: Winning in Business and Life Using Down-Home Wisdom" and share her experience developing her multi-billion dollar enterprise.

Each campus in the CSU system has its deadlines. Failure to meet a CSUSB deadline will result in the cancellation of your application. Deadline extensions or exemptions are not granted regardless of the reason.
CSUSB Admissions and Enrollment Deadlines for Fall 2020
Submit your 7th-semester transcripts, if required and/or official test scores from SAT or ACT

All Transfer students must submit all official partial transcripts from all institutions at which you are currently enrolled or all official final transcripts from all institutions you are no longer attending
Submit all official final transcripts and other documents required for your application
Student Orientation, Advising and Registration Program

Official documents must be delivered directly from the institution (schools) or organization (testing agency) issuing the document or must be mailed in a sealed envelope provided by the issuing organization. CSUSB accepts electronic documents sent via an official transcript delivery service. Please work with the issuing institution or organization to determine if your documents can be delivered to CSUSB electronically. Note, documents sent via email to CSUSB will not be considered official.

CSUSB must receive all official documents and test scores on or before the deadline date listed to be considered on time. Failure to submit documents or test scores will result in the cancellation of the student's application for admission.
Mail any supporting documents for your application to:

If you are submitting official documents or test scores electronically, they must be requested with enough time to ensure they are received on or before the deadline. CSUSB recommends submitting requests for electronic documents at least ten business days before a listed deadline.

Welcome to California State University, San Bernardino's Office of Admissions and Student Recruitment – your resource for answers to questions about visiting our campus, applying for admission and taking the next steps toward enrollment.

California State University, San Bernardino is located on 430 acres at the foothills of the San Bernardino Mountains. We are a medium-sized university featuring, small classes, modern and well-equipped labs and facilities, strong student support services and opportunities for close faculty contact.

One of the first questions asked about our campus is the cost of attendance for California State University, San Bernardino.  As a CSU, our tuition, fees and other costs are determined by the Board of Trustees, and the total amount you will pay for a year of study at CSUSB is determined by your academic profile.

California residents can expect to pay around $6,900 in Tuition costs per academic year, while non-resident and international students will pay close to $18,000.   You will also have associated costs for school, including fees, books, parking, housing and other related costs.
The CSUSB Office of Student Financial Services provides a listing of all student
* and payment deadlines and Parking Services provides current
Generally, establishing residence in California for tuition purposes requires a combination of both physical presence and intent to remain indefinitely.
An adult student must have established and maintained permanent residence in California at least one year prior to the residence determination date to show intent of becoming California resident.
For more information on establishing residency in California, visit our

Non-Resident Tuition Fees are $264 per unit and $132 per 1/2 unit.  Non-Resident Tuition is charged in addition to the charges listed above for residents and applies to all non-residents of California including international (visa) students.
WICHE WUE (Western University Exchange Program) student participants pay 150% of the Tuition Fee and do not pay Non-Resident Tuition Fees.
Non-resident students from Alaska, Arizona, Colorado, Hawaii, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, New Mexico, North Dakota, Oregon, South Dakota, Utah, Washington and Wyoming can participate in the
tuition rate, if eligible.  WUE allows students who are residents of the states listed to pay 150 percent of in-state (California) fees while retaining their home state residency status.
If you'd like to apply to participate in the WICHE/WUE program, download the application on our

Most students attending California State University, San Bernardino receive assistance in paying for their studies through Financial Aid and Scholarships. The CSUSB Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships administers a variety of programs to assist qualified students including Federal Pell Grants, Perkins Loans and Work-Study and scholarships awarded to new and continuing CSUSB students.

All students who plan to attend CSUSB should apply to FAFSA for access to federal assistance programs including Pell Grants and Work Study. Scholarships administered by the CSUSB Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships Office can be applied for online.

*The CSU makes every effort to keep student costs to a minimum. Fees listed in published schedules or student accounts may need to be increased when public funding is inadequate. Therefore, CSU must reserve the right, even after fees are initially charged or initial fee payments are made, to increase or modify any listed fees. All listed fees, other than mandatory systemwide fees, are subject to change without notice, until the date when instruction for a particular semester or quarter has begun. All CSU listed fees should be regarded as estimates that are subject to change upon approval by the Board of Trustees, the Chancellor, or the Presidents, as appropriate. Changes in mandatory systemwide fees will be made in accordance with the requirements of the Working Families Student Fee Transparency and Accountability Act (Sections 66028 - 66028.6 of the Education Code).
